project.teaser: In line with the Zero Pollution action plan and the Farm to Fork Strategy, Nutribudget will develop the prototype of a first-of-its-kind integrated nutrient management platform, called Nutriplatform, in various regions across Europe. The Nutriplatform will operate as a...
project.objective: In line with the Zero Pollution action plan and the Farm to Fork Strategy, Nutribudget will develop the prototype of a first-of-its-kind integrated nutrient management platform, called Nutriplatform, in various regions across Europe. The Nutriplatform will operate as a decision-support tool (DST) for farmers, advisors and regional authorities and before the end of the project this prototype (as a stand-alone or integrated in the existing EC promoted FaST tool for nutrient management) will be tested and used by at least 40.000 farmers across Europe. Firstly, the development of the Nutriplatform will be based on the algorithms of two advanced newly developed holistic Nutrimodels that quantify the impact of agronomic mitigation measures to optimize nutrient budget and flow across scales (from farm to Europe), across elements (C) and nutrients (N, P, K, S, Ca, Mg, Cu and Zn) and by looking at various agronomic and environmental targets. The measures will be derived from (I) existing knowledge, including input from relevant EU projects (e.g. the 4 on nutrient recycling from the call) and (II) new data from field experiments with innovative mitigation measures and combinations thereof that connect animal and crop production via agro-processing industries in 5 pilot regions (4 nutrient hotspot and 1 nutrient deficient area) in 4 different climate regions in Europe. Secondly, these measures will be linked to relevant monitoring indicators, called NutriKPIs, for agronomic performance in different farming systems, nutrient emissions and impact on biodiversity. All will be done in co-creation, according to a Nutri-actor approach, with a consortium of 17 partners from 10 countries that are all experts in their respective fields. Thereby, Nutribudget will contribute to systemically optimize nutrient management across different agricultural production systems and regions in the EU to reduce pollution due to the excessive use of nutrients and nutrient losses to the environment.
project.title: NUTRIBUDGET - Optimisation of nutrient budget in agriculture.
project.keywords: Nutrient models, mitigation measures, Zero-pollution, nutrient circularity, smart platform

article.title: Farmers test new nutrient management platform

result.title: Dissemination and exploitation plan
result.description: A detailed dissemination and exploitation plan including the identification, analysis and segmentation of the target audience for dissemination together with communication measures.

result.title: Communication plan
result.description: A detailed communication plan including the creation of a visual identity, procedures and standards for the Nutribudget project’s communication

result.title: Algorithms quantifying impacts of measures via field based indicators from satellite derived indices - initial version
result.description: Algorithms quantifying impacts of measures via field based indicators from satellite derived indices (e.g. compaction, yield (stress), timing agronomic events, runoff risks, etc) spatial are modelled, and the code is shared via github and made available via an API for further use – initial version

result.title: Quantified measure-impact relationship of selected measures - initial version
result.description: Quantified measure-impact relationship of selected measures – initial version [UGent, M18] (R, PU). A meta-analysis of field experimental data on agronomic measures to improve nutrient use efficiency and nutrient budgets on the indicators selected in WP3.

result.title: Report with overview of existing indicators used in national and European policies and market initiatives in relation to agronomic (e.g., yield, soil health) and environmental aims
result.description: Report with overview of existing indicators used in national and European policies and market initiatives in relation to agronomic (e.g., yield, soil health) and environmental aims (e.g, emissions to air and water), evaluating their usefulness on field, farm, regional and national scale given the aim that these indicators monitor the actual progress of farms to achieve the desired status for carbon and nutrient budgets.

result.title: Large reductions in nutrient losses needed to avoid future coastal eutrophication across Europe

details.authors: Aslihan Ural-Janssen, Carolien Kroeze, Erik Meers, Maryna Strokal

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - NutriBudget (NUTRIBUDGET - Optimisation of nutrient budget in agriculture.)
result.teaser: Nitrogen and phosphorus play an essential role in agriculture to maintain fertile and healthy soils, and ensure food security. However, overfertilisation has led to negative impacts on human health, biodiversity, water, air, and soil quality. In addition to this, there are...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Data/measurement matrix
result.description: This deliverable able to describes qualitatively and quantitatively the effect of the available farm-practices and agronomic measures and the data gaps still to be collected/validated

result.title: Initial report on the design of the Nutrimodel Framework and the results of running the baseline for nutrient and carbon flows using the Nutrimodels
result.description: The report includes a spatial nutrient and carbon flow analysis of all relevant plant nutrients (N, P, K, S, Mg, Ca, Cu, Zn) and their interactions, including carbon flows for the baseline. These results are part of T2.1.

result.title: Mitigation Measures Catalogue
result.description: An overview of relevant agronomic measures contributing to agricultural sustainability [first draft version M9], updated based on feedback in WP4

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
